cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (expected – currently a remnant low at 40 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas, or 450 miles SSE of Pensacola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north and making landfall along the northern Gulf Coast (FL Panhandle/AL) before moving inland toward the Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the AL/FL border

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Florida Big Bend (watch area AL/FL border to Ochlockonee River, FL)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (wind-probability table only covers Gulf Coast sites)
weather_observation.first_hazard: Start of heavy rainfall (from remnants mid-week)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at South Jersey Port Corp, NJ
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1-2 inches of rain around 18–19 Aug, but widespread flooding rain is not anticipated
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban flooding possible if local heavy downpours occur mid-week
